page.description: {HYPERLINK} creates a button that looks like a hyperlink.

argument.name: Label
argument.description: Character. The label of the button. The optional "= Variable " syntax allows you to use the contents of a variable as the button label.

argument.name: Event
argument.description: Character. The name of the event generated by the button.

page.example: dim button1Enabled as L = .t. dim dlg_body as C dlg_body = <<%dlg% When button 1 has focus, the Windows 'hand' cursor is used:; {hyperlink=Button1!Button1_clicked?Button1Enabled}; {lf}; (button1Enabled) Enable button?; %dlg% ui_dlg_box("Cursors",dlg_body,<<%code% if left(a_dlg_button,6) = "button" then ui_msg_box("Event",a_dlg_button ) a_dlg_button = "" end if %code%)
